bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 195 (Tuesday, November 17, 2020)][House][Pages H5867-H5868]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. ADAMS:H.R. 8758.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:[[Page H5868]]Article I, Section VII of the Constitution of the UnitedStates

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

item.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

summary.text:
Studying Veterans Access to Care During COVID-19 Act

This bill requires the Government Accountability Office to report on changes in the use of the beneficiary travel program of the Department of Veterans Affairs during the COVID-19 (i.e., coronavirus disease 2019) public health emergency period.

bill.title: Studying Veterans Access to Care During COVID–19 Act

item.title: Studying Veterans Access to Care During COVID–19 Act
Studying Veterans Access to Care During COVID–19 Act

To direct the Comptroller General of the United States to submit a report on changes in the use of the beneficiary travel program of the Department of Veterans Affairs during COVID-19, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
